Package ohos.rpc

Class ReliableFileDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.rpc.ReliableFileDescriptor

  • public class ReliableFileDescriptor
extends Object
    Wraps a reliable FileDescriptor that can be accessed from multiple threads.

    This class provides methods for creating a reliable data pipe and obtaining the wrapped FileDescriptor or native file descriptor.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  ReliableFileDescriptor.AutoCloseFileInputStream
      Represents a file input stream whose file descriptor is automatically closed when this stream is closed.
      static class  ReliableFileDescriptor.AutoCloseFileOutputStream
      Represents a file output stream whose file descriptor is automatically closed when this stream is closed.

      ReliableFileDescriptor​(FileDescriptor fd, FileDescriptor commonFd)
      A constructor used to create a ReliableFileDescriptor instance with the specified FileDescriptor and the file descriptor used to check file status.

      • ReliableFileDescriptor

        public ReliableFileDescriptor​(FileDescriptor fd,
                              FileDescriptor commonFd)
        A constructor used to create a ReliableFileDescriptor instance with the specified FileDescriptor and the file descriptor used to check file status.
        Parameters:
        fd - Indicates the FileDescriptor to wrap in the ReliableFileDescriptor instance.
        commonFd - Indicates the file descriptor used to check whether the file is closed.
        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • getFileDescriptor

        public FileDescriptor getFileDescriptor​()
        Obtains the FileDescriptor wrapped in this ReliableFileDescriptor.
        Returns:
        Returns the FileDescriptor wrapped in this ReliableFileDescriptor.
        Since:
        3

      • getNativeFd

        public int getNativeFd​()
        Obtains the native file descriptor wrapped in this ReliableFileDescriptor.

        This ReliableFileDescriptor still owns the file descriptor, which must be closed through this ReliableFileDescriptor.

        Returns:
        Returns the native file descriptor wrapped in this ReliableFileDescriptor. Do not use the return value to close the file descriptor or pass the return value to any method that assumes ownership of the file descriptor. Otherwise, the file descriptor will be closed repeatedly.
        Since:
        3

      • createPipe2

        public static ReliableFileDescriptor[] createPipe2​()
                                            throws OsHelperErrnoException
        Creates an array of two ReliableFileDescriptor objects.

        The array functions as a data pipe. One of the two objects is used to read data, and the other is used to write data.

        Returns:
        Returns the created array.
        Throws:
        OsHelperErrnoException - Throws this exception if the array fails to be created.
        Since:
        3

      • createReliablePipe

        public static ReliableFileDescriptor[] createReliablePipe​()
                                                   throws IOException,
                                                          OsHelperErrnoException
        Creates an array of two ReliableFileDescriptor objects, with each containing a socket file descriptor.

        The array functions as a data pipe. One of the two objects is used to read data, and the other is used to write data.

        Returns:
        Returns the created array.
        Throws:
        OsHelperErrnoException - Throws this exception if the array fails to be created.
        IOException - Throws this exception if the socket pair used to operate the data pipe fails to be created.
        Since:
        3

      • takeChargeOfFileDescriptor

        public static ReliableFileDescriptor takeChargeOfFileDescriptor​(int fd)
                                                         throws IOException,
                                                                OsHelperErrnoException
        Creates a ReliableFileDescriptor by duplicating an existing file descriptor.

        After the ReliableFileDescriptor is created, you must close it and the existing file descriptor.

        Parameters:
        fd - Indicates the existing file descriptor.
        Returns:
        Returns the created ReliableFileDescriptor.
        Throws:
        OsHelperErrnoException - Throws this exception if operating the file descriptor fails.
        IOException - Throws this exception if the ReliableFileDescriptor fails to be created.
        Since:
        4

      • dupFromSocket

        public static ReliableFileDescriptor dupFromSocket​(Socket socket)
                                            throws IOException,
                                                   OsHelperErrnoException
        Creates a ReliableFileDescriptor by duplicating the file descriptor of a specified socket.

        After the ReliableFileDescriptor is created, you must close it and the socket.

        Parameters:
        socket - Indicates the specified socket.
        Returns:
        Returns the created ReliableFileDescriptor.
        Throws:
        OsHelperErrnoException - Throws this exception if operating the file descriptor fails.
        IOException - Throws this exception if the ReliableFileDescriptor fails to be created.
        Since:
        4

      • getFileTotalSize

        public long getFileTotalSize​()
        Obtains the size of the file matching this file descriptor.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the file matching this file descriptor; returns -1 if this file descriptor does not match a file, for example, the file descriptor is a ReliableFileDescriptor obtained via Socket or Pipe.
        Since:
        4

      • close

        public void close​()
        Closes this ReliableFileDescriptor object.
        Since:
        5
